content.text: ● Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.1
● The length \(L\) of the pendulum is the distance between the bottom of the wooden blocks and the centre of the adhesive putty
Adjust the length of the string so that \(L\) is approximately \(53 \text{cm}\)
● Measure and record \(L\)
Use the second boss to attach the wooden rod to the stand. Adjust the apparatus until the vertical string of the pendulum just touches against the wooden rod, as shown in Fig. 1.2
● The distance between the bottom of the wooden blocks and the centre of the wooden rod is \(S\)
Adjust the position of the wooden rod so that \(S\) is approximately \(36 \text{cm}\)
● Measure and record \(S\)
● Calculate \((L - S)\)
● Move the adhesive putty a small distance so that the string moves away from the wooden rod. Release the adhesive putty. The string hits the rod as the pendulum oscillates
● Take measurements to determine the period \(T\) of the oscillations

Change \(S\) in the range \(5.0 \text{cm} \leqslant S \leqslant 45.0 \text{cm}\) by adjusting the position of the wooden rod. Determine \(T\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(S\) and \(T\)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\sqrt{(L - S)}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(T\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\sqrt{(L - S)}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =
y-intercept =

where \(A\) and \(B\) are constants
Using your answers in **(d)**(iii), determine the values of \(A\) and \(B\)
Give appropriate units
A =

where \(g\) is the acceleration of free fall
Use your answer in **(e)**(i) to determine a value for \(g\)
Give an appropriate unit
In this experiment, you will investigate the oscillations of a pendulum
You are provided with a wooden strip, as shown in Fig. 2.1
The dimensions of the strip are \(x\), \(y\) and \(z\)
Measure and record \(x\), \(y\) and \(z\)
· The volume \(V\) of the strip is given by the equation
Calculate \(V\)
Justify the number of significant figures that you have given for your value of \(V\)
● Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2
● Adjust the position of the boss so that the rod of the clamp is approximately \(0.30 \text{m}\) above the bench
● Use some of the adhesive putty to secure the \(30\mathrm{cm}\) ruler to the bench, as shown in Fig. 2.2

● The raised end of the wooden strip is R, as shown in Fig. 2.2. Place the wooden strip on the rod and adjust the position of the stand so that the distance between the rod and R is approximately \(5\mathrm{cm}\)

● Use adhesive putty to attach the mass to the wooden strip so that the distance \(d\) between the lower end of the wooden strip and the centre of the mass is approximately \(0.15 \text{m}\), as shown in Fig. 2.3
● Measure and record \(d\)
● Use adhesive putty to attach the loop of string at the raised end R of the wooden strip, as shown in Fig. 2.4
● Use the newton meter to determine the vertical force \(F\) needed to just lift the wooden strip from the rod
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(F\). Show your working
percentage uncertainty =   .........  %
● Adjust the position of the mass so that \(d\) is approximately \(0.30 \text{m}\)
● Measure and record \(d\) and \(F\)
It is suggested that the relationship between \(F\), \(x\) and \(d\) is
where \(W\) is the weight of the mass and has the value \(0.49 \text{N}\), and \(k\) is a constant
Using your data, calculate two values of \(k\)
first value of \(k =\)
second value of \(k =\)
It is suggested that the percentage uncertainty in the values of \(k\) is \(15\%\)
Using this uncertainty, explain whether your results support the relationship in **(c)**
Theory suggests that
where \(g\) is \(9.8 \text{N} \text{kg}^{-1}\) and \(\rho\) is the density of the wood
Use your second value of \(k\) and values from **(a)**(i) to determine \(\rho\)
Give an appropriate unit
Describe **four** sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
For any uncertainties in measurement that you describe, you should state the quantity being measured and a reason for the uncertainty
**You may not need to use all of the materials provided.**
In this experiment, you will investigate a wooden strip resting at an angle
Describe **four** improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
